page.title: 07Hatfield Heath Festival (1)
page.content: The Hatfield Heath Festival has taken place every year in the middle of June since 1969. It is held on the village heath and is the main fund-raising event in aid of the Village Hall and Institute, raising several thousands of pounds. A special committee is set up to deal with the organisation of the festival. Many of the villagers are involved in this. They make craft items and cakes to sell and some grow produce and plants. A marquee is erected and is used for refreshments over the weekend period. There are many different stalls with games you can play and things to buy. The grand draw attracts many customers and there are many big prizes donated by local organisations and others. The first prize is normally a sum of money such as Â£100.
